title: Football news: What Dani Ceballos told Kristoffer Olsson during altercation
text:
The duo exchanged words during run-in in the second half of game on Tuesday

Dani Ceballos told Kristoffer Olsson 'to stop acting like he was Messi' during their altercation in Spain's draw with Sweden on Tuesday night.

Marcus Berg opened the scoring for Sweden in the 50th minute of the Euro 2020 qualifying clash but Spain equalised through Rodrigo in stoppage time.

Spain midfielder Ceballos fouled Olsson and was subsequently shown a yellow card as Spain trailed in the match.

Dani Ceballos told Kristoffer Olsson 'to stop acting like he was Messi' in qualifier on Tuesday

The duo spoke to each other during the run-in in the second half and the Swedish international has revealed what the Arsenal man said to him.

'He said to me to stop acting like I was Messi,' Olsson said, as quoted by The Sun.

'I can't remember what I said back. I thought it was strange. I don't understand what he really meant.'
description: Spain midfielder Ceballos fouled Olsson and was subsequently shown a yellow card as Spain trailed in the match.
